concise_definition: v. 积累, 积聚, 逐渐增加

definitions.explanation_en: To gather or collect something gradually over time, often in increasing amounts, especially when the process is slow or continuous.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指随着时间推移逐渐收集或积聚某物，通常指数量缓慢而持续地增加。
definitions.example_en: Over the years, she accumulated a vast collection of rare books.
definitions.example_cn: 多年来，她积累了一大批稀有书籍。

definitions.explanation_en: To increase in quantity or degree through successive additions, often leading to a significant total or consequence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过连续的添加而使数量或程度逐渐增加，最终达到显著的总量或产生重大后果。
definitions.example_en: Dust accumulated on the shelves because no one cleaned for months.
definitions.example_cn: 由于几个月没人打扫，灰尘在书架上越积越多。

definitions.explanation_en: To build up (e.g., debt, pressure, or responsibility) over time, often unintentionally or as a result of neglect.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指（如债务、压力或责任）随着时间推移逐渐累积，常是无意中或因疏忽所致。
definitions.example_en: His unpaid bills accumulated until he faced legal action.
definitions.example_cn: 他的未付账单越积越多，最终导致他面临法律诉讼。

comparison.analysis: “Gather” (收集) 通常指有目的地将分散的物品或信息集中起来，动作较短暂且常具主动性，如 gather flowers 或 gather information。而 “accumulate” 强调的是长期、渐进、甚至被动的堆积过程，更侧重结果的累积性。
“Amass” (大量积聚) 与 “accumulate” 意义相近，但语气更强，常用于指大量财富、权力或资源的积累，带有更明显的目的性和规模感，有时隐含贬义（如 amass fortune through corruption）。而 “accumulate” 更中性，可用于日常或自然的积累过程。
“Build up” (逐步建立) 强调通过持续努力逐步形成某种结构、力量或状态，常用于积极语境（如 build up strength 或 build up a business）。而 “accumulate” 更侧重于数量或物质的被动叠加，不一定包含主动建设的含义。
